thread.title: Canes' Wisniewski to undergo surgery after tearing ACL
thread.title_full: Canes' Wisniewski to undergo surgery after tearing ACL

title: Canes' Wisniewski to undergo surgery after tearing ACL
text:
Canes' Wisniewski to undergo surgery after tearing ACL 
Posted 5:29 p.m. yesterday Your friends e-mail addresses (comma separated): * Subject: * You must enter the characters with black color that stand out from the other characters More on this More Hurricanes Stories 
Raleigh, N.C. — Carolina Hurricanes defenseman James Wisniewski will undergo surgery on his left knee and miss the remainder of the season after suffering a torn anterior cruciate ligament (ACL) during Thursday night’s game in Nashville. 
Acquired by the Hurricanes on June 27 from the Anaheim Ducks in exchange for Anton Khudobin, Wisniewski skated just 47 seconds in two shifts of his Hurricanes debut prior to suffering the injury. Wisniewski, 31, is in his 11th NHL season, after totaling eight goals and 26 assists in 69 games with Columbus and Anaheim in 2014-15. 
He has appeared in 552 career NHL regular-season games with Chicago, Anaheim, the New York Islanders, Montreal, Columbus and Carolina, totaling 53 goals and 221 assists and 459 penalty minutes. 
The Hurricanes play their home opener against the Detroit Red Wings Saturday, Oct. 10, at PNC Arena.
